sen.j: 根井 行親（ねのい ゆきちか、生年未詳 - 元暦元年1月20日 (旧暦)（1184年3月4日）?）は、平安時代末期の武将。
sen.e: Yukichika NENOI (year of birth unknown - March 11, 1184) was busho (Japanese military commander) in the late Heian period.
sen.cmt: 没年月日、ユリウス暦をグレゴリオ暦に変換しました。
sen.e: Yukichika NENOI (year of birth unknown - March 11, 1184) was a busho (Japanese military commander) who lived during the late Heian period.
Yukichika NENOI (year of birth unknown - March 11, 1184) was a busho (Japanese military commander) who lived during the late Heian period.

sen.j: 滋野氏の流れを汲む東信濃の名族望月氏の傍流。
sen.e: He was from a branch of the Mochizuki clan: a distinguished family in the eastern Shinano, which was descended from the Shigeno clan.
sen.cmt: 原文には「信濃国」とありましたが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「信濃」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、原文を修正して訳出しました。
sen.e: He was from a branch of the Mochizuki clan: a distinguished family in the eastern Shinano, which was descended from the Shigeno clan.
He was from a branch of the Mochizuki clan: a distinguished family in the eastern Shinano, which was descended from the Shigeno clan.

sen.j: 源義仲揮下の有力家臣にして、義仲四天王の一人。
sen.e: He was an influential retainer of MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka, and one of Yoshinaka Shitenno (four most loyal retainers of Yoshinaka).
He was an influential retainer of MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka, and one of Yoshinaka Shitenno (four most loyal retainers of Yoshinaka).
He was an influential retainer of MINAMOTO no Yoshinaka, and one of Yoshinaka Shitenno (four most loyal retainers of Yoshinaka).

sen.j: 滋野氏嫡流の海野幸親（滋野行親）と同一人物とする説もある。
sen.e: Some people say that he was the same person with Yukichika UNNO (also called Yukichika SHIGENO) who was a direct descendant of the Shigeno clan.
Some people say that he was the same person as Yukichika UNNO (also called Yukichika SHIGENO) who was a direct descendant of the Shigeno clan.
sen.cmt: 前置詞を変更しました。
sen.e: Some people say that he was the same person as Yukichika UNNO (also called Yukichika SHIGENO) who was a direct descendant of the Shigeno clan.

sen.j: 保元の乱では源義朝に従い、活躍したという。
sen.e: It is said that he took a lively part in the Hogen War under MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo's command.
It is said that he took a lively part in the Hogen War under MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo's command.
It is said that he took a lively part in the Hogen War under MINAMOTO no Yoshitomo's command.

sen.j: 治承四年（1180年）信濃国小県郡丸子の依田城で挙兵して以後、義仲に従い各地に転戦した。
sen.e: He took up arms at Yoda-jo Castle in Maruko, Chiisagata County, Shinano Province in 1180, and then took part in battles in various places following Yoshinaka.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He took up arms at Yoda-jo Castle in Maruko, Chiisagata County, Shinano Province in 1180, and then took part in battles in various places following Yoshinaka.
He took up arms at Yoda-jo Castle in Maruko, Chiisagata County, Shinano Province in 1180, and then took part in battles in various places following Yoshinaka.

sen.j: 養和元年（1181年）9月水津の合戦で平通盛、平経正らを破る。
sen.e: He defeated TAIRA no Michimori, TAIRA no Tsunemasa and so on in the Battle of Suizu in October 1181.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処水津の戦い－ 定訳不明グレゴリオ暦に変換しました。
sen.e: He defeated TAIRA no Michimori, TAIRA no Tsunemasa and so on in the Battle of Suizu in October 1181.
He defeated TAIRA no Michimori, TAIRA no Tsunemasa and so on in the Battle of Suizu in October 1181.

sen.j: 1184年、宇治川の合戦に参戦し、一族の武将たちに前後して敗死したとされている。
sen.e: It is said that he participated in the Battle of Uji River in 1184 and died in a losing cause more or less at the same time with other busho of his family.
sen.cmt: 川の表記の用語統一に従い"the Uji-gawa River"とすべきか迷いましたが、合戦名として登録用語のまま使用しました。
sen.e: It is said that he participated in the Battle of Uji River in 1184 and died in a losing cause at almost the same time with other busho of his family.
It is said that he participated in the Battle of Uji River in 1184 and died in a losing cause at almost the same time with other busho of his family.

sen.j: この戦いでは先陣を焦った頼朝方の武将畠山重忠の馬（磨墨）を射たという。
sen.e: In this battle, he shot the horse (named Surusumi) of Shigetada HATAKEYAMA, busho on the side of Yoritomo, who was in the scramble to be in the van.
sen.cmt: 「磨墨」（するすみ）は畠山重忠の馬となっていますが、梶原景季（同じく宇治川の戦いに参戦）の馬ではないかと思われます。原文どおり訳出してあります。
